law.text:
As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires:
"Commission" means the Kentucky Commission for Children with Special Health Care Needs, the Kentucky Crippled Children's Program, and the Kentucky Program of Health Services to children with special health care needs.
"Recipient" means any person who has received medical services provided by the commission or who has received medical services paid for on his behalf by the commission.
"Medical services" means medical or medically-related institutional or noninstitutional services which are provided to a recipient or paid for by the commission on behalf of a recipient.
"Third-party coverage" means any public or private party who is liable to provide medical services or to make medical services benefit payments to a recipient or other provider for medical services provided to a recipient under the terms of any contract, health insurance policy, health insurance plan, settlement, or award.
law.history: Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 405, sec. 58, effective July 15, 1994. -- Created 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 274, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1988.
